function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Occupant vulnerability in the built environment leading to potential exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of quantification of simulated output leading to inability to score design options based on contamination or infection rate.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Critical shortcomings in the 3d visualization technique may limit users’ ability to have an overview of the entire space.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relying solely on 3d representation for understanding complex behaviors and virus situations may lead to limited insights and understanding of the overall environment.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for virus transmission through surface-touching and face-touching behaviors","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 due to lack of understanding of design factors and their impacts.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for virus transmission in built environments from human interaction","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sharing physical tools mouse and keyboard during system testing","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Default simulation time step may not be optimal for modeling contagious diseases with different transmission rates and behaviors.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Accumulated surface contamination from interactable objects","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Manual assignment of tags to 3d objects","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex environmental aspects may impact virus transmission dynamics within the building.","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Real-time visualization of air contamination may lead to heightened awareness but could cause undue anxiety among building occupants.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Customization of occupant properties may lead to inaccurate simulation of virus spread.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Default values for virus properties may not reflect the characteristics of a specific virus, leading to inaccurate simulation results.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The visualization methods may oversimplify the complexity of virus transmission in the built environment, leading to misinterpretation of simulation results.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contaminated surfaces leading to virus transmission","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate simulation configuration leading to inaccurate results","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of virus particles in the built environment","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagion-related behaviours like breathing, sneezing, and coughing can lead to the spread of air-based contagions in the built environment.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface-based contagions from behaviors like surface-touching and hand-sanitizing may lead to the spread of contagious diseases through contact with contaminated surfaces.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Virtual humans with agency behaving realistically within the building model can simulate virus transmission scenarios.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modeling contagion-related human behaviors within the building can provide insights into virus spread dynamics.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for micro-level behaviors such as breathing and touching in covid-19 transmission scenarios","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Focus on small spaces with simple geometry in existing virus transmission simulations","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incomplete integration of agency into virtual humans to incorporate dynamics of human behaviour within the building.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Relying solely on macro-level mobility aspects in the simulation without considering micro-level interactions within environments.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overlooking connectivity between spaces due to building design can contribute to air-based and surface-based transfer of pathogens.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Virus transmission within physical spaces via air-based diffusion and circulation","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus transmission via touching interactions with surfaces","category":"Water","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation through human-building interactions","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited focus on long-term effects of human-building interactions","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Simulating the locations or moving trajectories of people in architectural-scale designs","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for virus transmission in early design evaluation","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential risk of virus transmission within the context of covid-19 due to the design of the occupancy simulation system.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dynamic human-building interactions influencing virus transmission","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding routes of virus transmission in specific conditions","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission due to the large number of passersby throughout the day in a particular area.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential asynchronous transmission of the virus by a single individual contaminating a shared environment.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Virus transmission via surfaces and air circulation within the built environment","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of objective data on noise measurement and sound insulation of buildings hinders accurate assessment of indoor noise sources.","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Difference in neighbor noise perception based on time spent in different areas of the house","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Significant increase in indoor noise levels during the lockdown","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through physical contact and airborne particles due to close proximity in densely populated living spaces.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through shared communal spaces and contact with commonly touched surfaces.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through manual extraction of tweets","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased noise levels during lockdown may lead to an increase in human interaction and activity, contributing to the potential spread of contagious diseases","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of capital outflows and economic damage to low-income countries","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to clean water and proper sanitation leading to increased risk of contagious diseases","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in developing an effective vaccine for covid-19","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"}]}
